intro: Amsinckia hirticaulis, commonly known as the hairy stempleaf, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically hairy and lance-shaped, and the plant often grows in rocky or sandy soils. Amsinckia hirticaulis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
